column1: Shaken baby injuries usually occur in children younger than 2 years old, but may be seen in children up to the age of 5.
This can cause bruising of the brain (cerebral contusion), swelling, pressure, and bleeding in the brain.
It also is very unlikely to occur from accidents such as falling off chairs or down stairs, or accidentally being dropped from a caregiver's arms.

They may include: - Convulsions (seizures) - Decreased alertness - Extreme irritability or other changes in behavior - Lethargy, sleepiness, not smiling - Loss of consciousness - Loss of vision - No breathing - Pale or bluish skin - Poor feeding, lack of appetite - Vomiting There may not be any physical signs of injury, such as bruising, bleeding, or swelling.
